PROPERTY.Name: Age degradation rate
PROPERTY.HELP: How fast this building's condition decays over time. The "life expectancy" of the plant in months can be calculated roughly as the reciprocal of this number. Thus, a plant with a 50-year lifespan will have a base decay rate of 1.0 / (50 * 12) and 0.00333 = 25 years.

PROPERTY.Name: Soft failure threshold
PROPERTY.HELP: When a building's "Age Degradation" exceeds this level, the plant will begin to exhibit various kinds of "soft" failures (visual distress, sounds, frequent outages, etc.). This will typically be a number near 1.0.

PROPERTY.Name: Hard failure threshold
PROPERTY.HELP: When a building's "Age Degradation" exceeds this level, the plant will either become abandoned or will have a chance to undergo violent catastrophic failure (i.e., blow up). This will typically be 1.0 or higher.
